oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Inquiry regarding name and dwelling-place. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-19. 5448-5452). Dia!kwain longs to hear the words of his own language. 1) See also Oh old woman! At what place did you grow up?, 2) This story is found in Book V-19.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Thy name which is a Bushman name, what is it?'
